title: Adaptive Dynamic Programming Design for Intelligent Energy Management Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamentals of power systems, basic programming skills, and machine learning concepts
context.additional_context: Combines hands-on digital device practice with theoretical lectures, conducting problem-solving projects based on real residential scenarios

learning_goals: Using adaptive dynamic programming algorithms (e.g., DP with sliding window), learners design a system blueprint for a power grid scenario to reduce energy costs by 15% and achieve a load balance index ≥0.8, scoring ≥2/3 on a peer/instructor rubric (algorithm suitability, cost efficiency, scalability).
Battery management strategies for renewable energy integration can be mathematically modeled and experimentally tested.
A neural network dynamically adjusting energy management policies according to fluctuating environmental conditions (e.g., weather data) is implemented.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
